definition: a friend in times of tribulations (idiom); a friend in need is a friend indeed
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: John and Jack went through many troubles together to become foul weather friends.
sentences.chinese: 约翰和杰克经历了许多麻烦，一起成为患难之交。

sentences.english: A poor friend, because a friend in need is a friend indeed.
sentences.chinese: 贫穷的朋友，因为患难之交是真情。

sentences.english: Thailand and China enjoy brotherly relations and are sincere friends sharing weal and woe.
sentences.chinese: 泰中两国情同手足，是患难之交和真诚的朋友。

sentences.english: Your friend in adversity may be among the best of your friends. He is the most patient and cheerful spiritual companion.
sentences.chinese: 患难之交可以成为挚友，他最有耐心而令人愉悦。

sentences.english: We all knew that a friend in need is a friend indeed.
sentences.chinese: 我们都知道，患难之交才是真朋友。

sentences.english: A friend indeed is a friend in need.
sentences.chinese: 患难见真情和患难之交才是真正的朋友。

definition: as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
true sentiments are seen in hard times (idiom)/you see who your true friends are when you go through tough times together/you see who your true friends are when you are in difficulties
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
as close as brothers (idiom); deep friendship
to stick together through thick and thin (idiom)
To enjoy blessings and endure misfortune together (idiom); for better or for worse
pinyin: you3 fu2 tong2 xiang3 , you3 nan4 tong2 dang1

definition: not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
erhua variant of 鐵哥們|铁哥们[tie3 ge1 men5]
